alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Kearny; Morton; Scott; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 08 at 2:27PM CST until November 09 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Scott, Hamilton, Kearny, Stanton and Morton Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could knock down large tree limbs, create light property damage, and cause some power disruptions. Expect travel to be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles and around agricultural fields where visibility can briefly fall well below one mile in blowing dust. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The ongoing long-term exceptional drought conditions will lead to blowing dust. Blowing dust may lead to widespread visibility less than one mile at times and locally one quarter mile or less around some agricultural fields.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
